paper_abstract: Let phi be a formula of Lukasiewicz infinite-valued propositional logic having a total of l many occurrences of n distinct propositional variables (call l the length of phi). Results in Aguzzoli and Ciabattoni [Finiteness in infinite-valued Lukasiewicz logic, Journal of Logic, Language and Information, 9 (2000) 5-29] show that if phi is not a tautology then there is an MV chain A of cardinality <= [(l/n)(n)] + 1 together with an evaluation e(A) of propositional variables in A, such that e(A) is a countermodel for phi, that is e(A) (phi) < 1(A). We show that for each integer n > 0 the function b(n, l) = (l/n)(n) + 1 yields an asymptotically tight upper bound on the maximum cardinality of the smallest MV algebras having countermodels for formulas of length l. (c) 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: An asymptotically tight bound on countermodels for Lukasiewicz logic
